intro: Peucedanum camerunense, commonly known as African cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its seeds are small and dry, often dispersed by wind, and it has some traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
